The rooftop bar at Hotel 50 Bowery is definitely a highlight!

Now, about the sightseeing pass: Absolutely, it's worth considering! A sightseeing pass can be a fantastic way to save time and money on attractions, especially if you plan to visit multiple popular spots during your trip.

The New York City Explorer Pass is a popular option, and it can be a great value depending on your plans. Here's a brief rundown:

**New York City Explorer Pass:**

* Choose from 3, 5, 7, or 10 attractions from a list of over 50 popular spots, including:
	+ Iconic landmarks: Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, One World Observatory
	+ Museums: American Museum of Natural History, Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), 9/11 Memorial & Museum
	+ Other attractions: Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, Central Park Zoo, Madame Tussauds
* Save up to 50% compared to buying individual tickets
* Valid for 30 days, so you can spread out your attractions over several days
* Includes a free guidebook and map to help plan your itinerary

**Pros:**

* Convenience: One pass grants you admission to multiple attractions, saving you time and hassle.
* Cost-effective: Can be a significant cost savings compared to buying individual tickets.
* Flexibility: Choose from a range of attractions and create your own itinerary.

**Cons:**

* You need to plan ahead and choose your attractions carefully to get the most value from the pass.
* Some attractions might have limited availability or require reservations, so be sure to check ahead of time.
* You might feel rushed to fit in all the attractions on your list.

Other popular sightseeing passes in New York City include the New York Pass, Freestyle Pass, and Sightseeing Day Pass. Be sure to research and compare the different options to find the one that best fits your plans and budget.

To get the most out of a sightseeing pass, consider the following:

* Plan your itinerary carefully to ensure you can visit all the attractions you want within the valid period.
* Prioritize your must-see attractions and make reservations or plan accordingly to avoid sold-out situations.
* Take advantage of the free guidebook and map to optimize your time and navigate the city.

If you think a sightseeing pass will help you save time and money, go for it! Just be sure to read the fine print and plan wisely to get the most value from your pass.

How does that sound? Are you considering purchasing a sightseeing pass for your girls' trip?
